intro: Cologania pulchella f. glabrior, commonly known as the smoothleaf cologania, is a variant of the species Cologania pulchella, characterized by its reduced pubescence. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is native to South America. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. This form is noted for its horticultural appeal due to its refined foliage and delicate floral display.
